To learn of today’s tragedy at Cleveland VA Medical Center is heartbreaking. My prayers are with the family, friends and military community affected by veteran suicide.  Many of our servicemembers are in crisis. I’m proud the HCVA is taking steps to address suicide prevention.

To hear news of yet another shooting in a place of worship is heartbreaking. My condolences to all the victims of today’s shooting in Poway, CA, and their families.  My prayers are with them, the Congregation Chabad, the city of Poway and the entire Jewish community. https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1122231915753496576 …

In OH-11, women earn close to $11,000 less than a man each year or 77 cents to every dollar men earn. That is $11,000 that could go to supporting her family, contributing to the economy, furthering her education and much more. It’s time for #EqualPayForEqualWork. pic.twitter.com/oViXZnNyCE

Pay equity is not a moral imperative, it is critical to boost women’s financial security. Based on today’s wage gap, a woman who worked full-time, year round would lose $406,760 over a 40-year career. #PaycheckFairnessAct pic.twitter.com/MdO98OXFt9
It is 2019 and women are still paid 80 cents for every $1 paid to male counterparts.  For women of color, the #WageGap is much larger. #PaycheckFairnessAct pic.twitter.com/zoNxX7Z9jR
The #DirtyWaterRule ignores science, law, and huge public support for commonsense protections for clean water.  We can't allow it to move forward. #ProtectCleanWater pic.twitter.com/kfCoWv7jxK

American families do not want a future of more polluted rivers and dirtier water flowing through their taps for their kids children to drink.  The #DirtyWaterRule puts our water and our health at risk.  We must reject this rule and #ProtectCleanWater. pic.twitter.com/wuN7JUEnU9
You do not get clean water by canceling safeguards for streams, wetlands and drinking water.  We must #ProtectCleanWater by fighting the President's #DirtyWaterRule! pic.twitter.com/g1HSBnCMLR

Slashing safeguards for clean water will impact all of us.  But the #DirtyWaterRule will disproportionately harm low-income communities and communities of color.  We must reject this rule and #ProtectCleanWater. pic.twitter.com/PvlOtKhMU3
